name: Jessica N. Au
tagline: I decode the patterns mutations leave behind in your DNA
intro: Currently a PhD researcher in bioinformatics & systems biology at UC San Diego, building tools to understand how mutations shape disease.

paragraphs: I'm a Ph.D. Candidate in Bioinformatics & Systems Biology at UCSD, working in the Alexandrov Lab. My research sits at the intersection of biology and computer science to study precision oncology.
I'm currently developing a high-definition mutational signature reference using 50,000+ whole-genome sequences, build AI-powered curation systems, and create interactive tools for exploring them.
When I'm not analyzing mutations, I'm painting watercolors, out fishing, or tending to a succulent collection that has gotten slightly out of hand.

footer.credit: Designed & built by me, with the help of Claude
footer.sub: Good science, good design, and a little too much coffee.
